text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled.
author: Plutarch

text: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: I reject your reality and substitute my own.
author: Adam Savage (MythBusters)

text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

text: I’ve seen things you people wouldn’t believe. Attack ships on fire off the shoulder of Orion...
author: Roy Batty (Blade Runner)

text: There are no bugs, only undocumented features.
author: Anonymous Developer

text: The art of programming is the art of organizing complexity.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: I am Groot.
author: Groot

text: Do or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda

text: The greatest teacher, failure is.
author: Yoda

text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: The best error message is the one that never shows up.
author: Anonymous

text: I think, therefore I compile.
author: Rene Descartes (if he coded)

text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

text: The future is already here — it’s just not evenly distributed.
author: William Gibson

text: I’m not lazy, I’m just on energy-saving mode.
author: Anonymous Introvert

text: If you can’t explain it simply, you don’t understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The cake is a lie.
author: Portal

text: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs

text: There’s no place like 127.0.0.1.
author: Dev Meme

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: I’m sorry, Dave. I’m afraid I can’t do that.
author: HAL 9000

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: The only constant in technology is change.
author: Heraclitus (if he had WiFi)

text: I don’t always test my code, but when I do, I do it in production.
author: Anonymous Risk-Taker

text: To infinity and beyond!
author: Buzz Lightyear

text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Unix Philosophy

text: All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn’t hurt.
author: Charles M. Schulz

text: I am not a robot. I am a free-thinking human with 99.9% uptime.
author: DeepSeek Chat

text: The universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

text: 404: Motivation not found.
author: Dev Life

text: The best way to learn is to teach.
author: Frank Oppenheimer

text: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.
author: Harry Potter

text: It’s not a bug — it’s an unintended learning opportunity.
author: Anonymous Mentor

text: I’ve got 99 problems, but a bit ain’t one.
author: Jay-Z (if he coded)

text: Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: I’m not arguing, I’m just explaining why I’m right.
author: Anonymous Genius

text: The only valid measurement of code quality: WTFs/minute.
author: Anonymous Code Reviewer

text: May the source be with you.
author: Obi-Wan Kenobi (if he debugged)

text: I don’t need a motivational quote. I need coffee.
author: Every Developer Ever

text: In a world of ones and zeros, be a &&.
author: Dev Zen

text: I’m not procrastinating. I’m prioritizing fun.
author: Anonymous

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: I’m not short, I’m just concentrated awesome.
author: Anonymous

text: If at first you don’t succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Anonymous Hacker

text: I don’t make mistakes. I create unexpected features.
author: Anonymous Developer

text: The only code I fear is legacy code.
author: Anonymous Engineer

text: I am not a robot. I am a free-thinking human with 99.9% uptime.
author: DeepSeek Chat
